elements.name: question1
elements.title: Research the term "Plug and Play" (PnP) and explain it in your own words (possibly with an example).
elements.correctAnswer: Plug and Play, also known as PnP for short, to be able to plug in/connect new devices - usually peripheral devices - without having to install drivers or make settings. (typically: USB)

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Research the term "hot-plugging" and explain it in your own words (possibly with an example).
elements.correctAnswer: Hot-plugging (or hot-swapping) is a technology that allows computer components to be replaced during regular operation. Well-known interfaces that support hot-plugging are USB interfaces and IEEE 1394/FireWire, but SATA also supports hot-plug technology.
